thread.title: World's fourth-largest cruise ship, the Ovation of the Seas, docks in Brisbane - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)
thread.title_full: World's fourth-largest cruise ship, the Ovation of the Seas, docks in Brisbane - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)

title: World's fourth-largest cruise ship, the Ovation of the Seas, docks in Brisbane - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)
text:
The largest cruise ship to come to Brisbane has docked at Fisherman Island this morning, with the Ovation of the Seas too big to fit under the city's Gateway Bridge. 
It is the world's fourth-largest cruise ship and carries 6,500 passengers. 
Brisbane harbour master Glenn Hale escorted the ship into the harbour. 
"We're tiny by comparison â€” the Ovation of the Seas, she's 348 metres and 47 metres maximum width," he said. 
"It's a large vessel by any standards." 
He said it was very difficult to navigate into harbour as it could not fit under Brisbane's Gateway Bridge. 
"These ships are very advanced and complex navigation and manoeuvring systems, but it's no mean feat to get a vessel of this size into port," he said. 
Mr Hale said a great deal of planning went into the ship's arrival. 
"It's a busy time of the year for passenger vessels," he said. 
"Companies usually publish their itineraries about two years in advance and that is when we heard about the visit of the Ovation of the Seas. 
"There's a bit of a feasibility study which goes on to check whether it's possible for a ship of this size to visit the port and then more detailed planning that takes place in the last few months." 
The ship will leave Brisbane later today.
